channel.title: EYC Team Race Blog
channel.description: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

item.title: We gotta pay to play
item.description:
EYC is supporting us, we have to support them - for many reasons. We get to use the J-22s, we have Nan supporting us, and the support of the board. We need to show that we appreciate it. There are also insurance things to consider.

So, we ALL need to sign up as pay the nominal fees and sign the waiver to be a part of the team. Both Skippers AND Crew.

Skippers - $250 plus deposit (a hold on a CC) Crew - $100

* For just a bit more, you can also get access to the club’s fleet of kayaks, SUPs, etc - and access to the J-22s on days other than Monday or Tuesday **

We expect 100% participation!

Click the link - EYC Watercraft Access Program - It’s quick and easy. Contact Nan Walker with any questions - waterfront@eastportyc.org

item.title: AYC 3-2-1 Regatta - May 20 - We need players!
item.description:
Our first event of the season! This is a one day regatta hosted by AYC, but using the EYC boats as well.

This event has three formats rolled into a one day event, 3 on 3 team racing, 2 on 2 team racing, and match racing. What a great way to experience all the disciplines!

All you need to do is to be able to crew a j-22. we’ve got some experienced types that will be driving, we need 3 or 4 more people to round out the team.

Contact Logan Hearn - loghearn@gmail.com - 443.254.3671 to sign up, or ask questions.

item.title: Practice is on!
item.description:
Practice is on! First night is Monday, April 30!

All skippers and crews - we have boats ready to sail, and we need bodies!

If you plan to be a t practice Monday night, respond to this email or text 410-320-1843 with your name, email address and cell number If we get enough people, we will have a practice and then some fun talking about it afterwards.

We need RSVPs to make sure we have enough people to warrant splashing the boats.
